title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement stephus.daus@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Create a Pre-defined Directory Hierarchy on Disk — create_directory_structure
text: path String, path create project files structure_path String. Path YAML file defines folder structure. Defaults system.file("templates", "_project_structure_en.yaml"). numbering_prefix String. One c("none", "max_local", "max_global"). numbering_inheritance Flag. Whether inherit numbering parent folder. word_separator String. Replace separators words folder names. Defaults NULL. numbering_parent_child_separator String. Defaults word_separator. numbering_name_separator String. Separator numbering part name. case String. One c("asis", "sentence", "lower", "upper", "title", "snake"). replacement_list named character vector. name vector replaced "{{value}}" structure_path file create Boolean. Defaults TRUE initialize_saros_project(), FALSE create_directory_structure(). count_existing_folders Boolean. Defaults FALSE.

what: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
text: Create Folder Placeholder R-files Based Structure CSV-file

title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
code: create_r_files(   r_files_out_path,   r_files_source_path = system.file("templates", "r_files.csv", package = "saros.utils"),   r_optionals = TRUE,   r_add_file_scope = TRUE,   r_prefix_file_scope = "### ",   r_add_folder_scope_as_README = FALSE,   word_separator = NULL,   case = c("asis", "sentence", "title", "lower", "upper", "snake"),   numbering_prefix = c("none", "max_local", "max_global"),   numbering_inheritance = TRUE,   numbering_parent_child_separator = word_separator,   numbering_name_separator = " " )

title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
text: r_files_out_path String, path place R placeholder files. NULL, create . r_files_source_path String, path find CSV-field containing columns folder_name, folder_scope, file_name, file_scope. NULL, defaults system.file("templates", "r_files.csv")). r_optionals Flag. Whether add files marked 1 (TRUE) optional column. Defaults TRUE. r_add_file_scope Flag. Whether add value column 'file_scope' beginning file. Default TRUE. r_prefix_file_scope String add file_scope. Defaults "### " r_add_folder_scope_as_README Flag. Whether create README file folder folder_scope column cell r_files_source_path. Defaults FALSE. word_separator String. Replace separators words folder names. Defaults NULL. case String. One c("asis", "sentence", "lower", "upper", "title", "snake"). numbering_prefix String. One c("none", "max_local", "max_global"). numbering_inheritance Flag. Whether inherit numbering parent folder. numbering_parent_child_separator String. Defaults word_separator. numbering_name_separator String. Separator numbering part name.

title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
code: create_r_files(r_files_out_path=tempdir())

text: Wrapper Download Unzip Github Repository Folder

title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
code: download_zip_to_folder(   github_zip_url = "https://github.com/NIFU-NO/nifutemplates/archive/refs/heads/main.zip",   zip_path = tempfile(fileext = ".zip"),   files = NULL,   out_path = getwd(),   prompt = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   open_project = FALSE,   newSession = TRUE )

title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
text: github_zip_url URL zip file, string. zip_path String, store zip-file. Defaults temporary location. files Character vector files zip-file include. See zip::unzip(). out_path String, directory store unzipped files. prompt Flag, whether ask user conflicting files overwritten, . Defaults TRUE. overwrite Flag, whether overwrite files out_path. Defaults FALSE. open_project Flag string. FALSE (default), nothing. TRUE (requires rstudioapi-pkg), opens assumed .Rproj-file out_path copying, gives warning found. Alternatively, string (path) can provided. Defaults file.path(out_path, ".Rproj") exists. Set NULL FALSE ignore. newSession Flag. Whether open new project new RStudio session. Defaults TRUE.

title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
text: Character vector unzipped files.

title: Handle numbering inheritance — handle_numbering_inheritance

title: Handle numbering inheritance — handle_numbering_inheritance
code: handle_numbering_inheritance(   counter = 1,   numbering_prefix = c("none", "max_global", "max_local"),   max_folder_count_digits = 0,   parent_path = "Journal manuscripts",   parent_numbering = NA,   numbering_parent_child_separator = "_",   count_existing_folders = FALSE )

title: Handle numbering inheritance — handle_numbering_inheritance
text: counter digit numbering_prefix One "none" (zero-leading prefix), "max_global" (counts leading zeroes matching maximally observed items subfolders), "max_local" (max_global, considering current folder item) max_folder_count_digits Integer. fixed width counting. parent_path String, path parent folder. parent_numbering String, NA. NA, adds parent_numbering left side counter. numbering_parent_child_separator String, separates parent number child number, parent_numbering NA. count_existing_folders Flag. Whether consider existing folders counting. Defaults FALSE.

title: Handle numbering inheritance — handle_numbering_inheritance
text: String

what: Return character vector of manually picked data columns. — handpick
title: Return character vector of manually picked data columns. — handpick
text: works interactive session. Copies clipboard to_clipboard = TRUE, clipboard available system.

title: Return character vector of manually picked data columns. — handpick
code: handpick(data, to_clipboard = FALSE, bare = FALSE)

title: Return character vector of manually picked data columns. — handpick
text: data dataset; data frame. to_clipboard Boolean. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, overwrites already copied. Use caution. bare Flag, defaults FALSE. TRUE, returns tidyselect-style bare list columns, without quotation marks.

title: Return character vector of manually picked data columns. — handpick
text: Character vector. Prints console.

title: Return character vector of manually picked data columns. — handpick
code: if(interactive()) handpick(mtcars)

title: Initialize Folder Structure — initialize_saros_project
text: Can used programatically console, simply use New Project Wizard.

title: Initialize Folder Structure — initialize_saros_project
code: initialize_saros_project(   path,   structure_path = NULL,   numbering_prefix = c("none", "max_local", "max_global"),   numbering_inheritance = TRUE,   word_separator = NULL,   numbering_name_separator = " ",   replacement_list = NULL,   numbering_parent_child_separator = word_separator,   case = c("asis", "sentence", "title", "lower", "upper", "snake"),   count_existing_folders = FALSE,   r_files_out_path = NULL,   r_files_source_path = system.file("templates", "r_files.csv", package = "saros.utils"),   r_optionals = TRUE,   r_add_file_scope = TRUE,   r_prefix_file_scope = "### ",   r_add_folder_scope_as_README = FALSE,   create = TRUE )

title: Initialize Folder Structure — initialize_saros_project
text: path String, path create project files structure_path String. Path YAML file defines folder structure. Defaults system.file("templates", "_project_structure_en.yaml"). numbering_prefix String. One c("none", "max_local", "max_global"). numbering_inheritance Flag. Whether inherit numbering parent folder. word_separator String. Replace separators words folder names. Defaults NULL. numbering_name_separator String. Separator numbering part name. replacement_list named character vector. name vector replaced "{{value}}" structure_path file numbering_parent_child_separator String. Defaults word_separator. case String. One c("asis", "sentence", "lower", "upper", "title", "snake"). count_existing_folders Boolean. Defaults FALSE. r_files_out_path String, path place R placeholder files. NULL, create . r_files_source_path String, path find CSV-field containing columns folder_name, folder_scope, file_name, file_scope. NULL, defaults system.file("templates", "r_files.csv")). r_optionals Flag. Whether add files marked 1 (TRUE) optional column. Defaults TRUE. r_add_file_scope Flag. Whether add value column 'file_scope' beginning file. Default TRUE. r_prefix_file_scope String add file_scope. Defaults "### " r_add_folder_scope_as_README Flag. Whether create README file folder folder_scope column cell r_files_source_path. Defaults FALSE. create Boolean. Defaults TRUE initialize_saros_project(), FALSE create_directory_structure().

title: Initialize Folder Structure — initialize_saros_project
code: initialize_saros_project(path = tempdir()) #> [1] "Rtmpt8F1nx"

what: Recode Missing By Type of Missingness — omitted_recoder_df
title: Recode Missing By Type of Missingness — omitted_recoder_df
text: Useful item difficulty estimation according Mislevy's recommendation. Also allowing escaping rows missingess (typically administered).

title: Recode Missing By Type of Missingness — omitted_recoder_df
code: omitted_recoder_df(   df,   accept_vector = FALSE,   skipped = 0L,   not_administered = NA_integer_,   all_missing = NA_integer_ )

title: Recode Missing By Type of Missingness — omitted_recoder_df
text: df Data frame, vector. Must dataframe, matrix, function. include item variables. accept_vector Handles vectors accept_vector=TRUE. Set false avoid accidents using function per block just one item block. skipped replace skipped values not_administered replace administered values . all_missing replace values rows missing .

title: Recode Missing By Type of Missingness — omitted_recoder_df
text: data.frame (vector, input vector accept_vector=TRUE) recoded cells.

title: Recode Missing By Type of Missingness — omitted_recoder_df
code: # Original data input <- stats::setNames(as.data.frame(matrix(c(   1,0,1,0,1, # All present   NA,0,1,0,1, # First missing   NA,NA,1,0,1, # First two missing   1,0,NA,0,1, # One in middle missing   1,NA,NA,NA,1, # All in the middle missing   1,0,1,0,NA, # Last one missing   1,0,1,NA,NA, # Last two missing   1,0,NA,NA,NA, # Last three missing   NA,NA,NA,NA,NA # All missing ), nrow = 9, byrow = TRUE)), nm=stringi::stri_c(ignore_null=TRUE, "X", 1:5)) # What should be the output for item estimation according to Mislevy # Skipped=> 0, not_administered=>NA, all_missing=>NA y_i <-  stats::setNames(as.data.frame(matrix(c(   1,0,1,0,1, # All present   0,0,1,0,1, # First missing   0,0,1,0,1, # First two missing   1,0,0,0,1, # One in middle missing   1,0,0,0,1, # All in the middle missing   1,0,1,0,0, # Last one missing   1,0,1,0,NA, # Last two missing   1,0,0,NA,NA, # Last three missing   NA,NA,NA,NA,NA # All missing ), nrow = 9, byrow = TRUE)), nm=stringi::stri_c(ignore_null=TRUE, "X", 1:5))  # What should be the output for person estimation according to Mislevy # Skipped=> 0, not_administered=>NA, all_missing=>NA y_p <- stats::setNames(as.data.frame(matrix(c(   1,0,1,0,1, # All present   0,0,1,0,1, # First missing   0,0,1,0,1, # First two missing   1,0,0,0,1, # One in middle missing   1,0,0,0,1, # All in the middle missing   1,0,1,0,0, # Last one missing   1,0,1,0,0, # Last two missing   1,0,0,0,0, # Last three missing   0,0,0,0,0 # All missing ), nrow = 9, byrow = TRUE)), nm=stringi::stri_c(ignore_null=TRUE, "X", 1:5)) # Recoding for counting skipped, not_administered, all_missing, etc # Skipped=> 99, not_administered=>999, all_missing=>9999 y_info <- stats::setNames(as.data.frame(matrix(c(   1,0,1,0,1, # All present   99,0,1,0,1, # First missing   99,99,1,0,1, # First two missing   1,0,99,0,1, # One in middle missing   1,99,99,99,1, # All in the middle missing   1,0,1,0,99, # Last one missing   1,0,1,99,999, # Last two missing   1,0,99,999,999, # Last three missing   9999,9999,9999,9999,9999 # All missing ), nrow = 9, byrow = TRUE)), nm=stringi::stri_c(ignore_null=TRUE, "X", 1:5))  y_i2 <- omitted_recoder_df(input) #Mislevy item estimation y_p2 <- omitted_recoder_df(input, skipped = 0L, #Mislevy person estimation                            not_administered = 0L, all_missing = 0L) y_info2 <- omitted_recoder_df(input, skipped = 99,                               not_administered = 999, all_missing = 9999) identical(y_i, y_i2) #> [1] TRUE identical(y_p, y_p2) #> [1] TRUE identical(y_info, y_info2) #> [1] TRUE if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ omitted_recoder_df(input[,4]) # Should fail } # } identical(omitted_recoder_df(input[,4], accept_vector=TRUE),          c(0,0,0,0,0,0,0,NA,NA)) #> [1] TRUE identical(omitted_recoder_df(input[,4, drop=FALSE]),           input[,4, drop=FALSE]) # Output should equal input #> Warning: Unable to recode single-column data.frame without knowing context. #> [1] TRUE

what: Recodes Multiple Sets of Factor Variables of Checkbox Items — recode_checkbox_sets
title: Recodes Multiple Sets of Factor Variables of Checkbox Items — recode_checkbox_sets
text: Qualtrics produces datasets matrix set checkbox questions value labels (factor labels) representing actual question. presenting questions figure table, however, often useful recode value labels something common, e.g. "Selected" "selected".

title: Recodes Multiple Sets of Factor Variables of Checkbox Items — recode_checkbox_sets
code: recode_checkbox_sets(   data,   var_patterns = NULL,   input_check_value = 1L,   input_uncheck_value = NA_integer_,   output_check_value = 2L,   output_uncheck_value = 1L,   output_all_unchecked_value = NA_integer_,   output_check_label = "Selected",   output_uncheck_label = "Not selected",   output_all_unchecked_label = NULL,   convert_to_factor = TRUE,   keep_tmp_var = FALSE )

title: Recodes Multiple Sets of Factor Variables of Checkbox Items — recode_checkbox_sets
text: data Data frame tibble. var_patterns Character vector regex search patterns uniquely identify variables belonging sets batteries. used tidyselect's matches(). input_check_value, input_uncheck_value Factor/integer values indicating checked unchecked responses. output_check_value, output_uncheck_value Recoded values checked unchecked responses. output_all_unchecked_value respondent checked checkboxes, recoded ? Set NULL recode. output_check_label, output_uncheck_label, output_all_unchecked_label Factor labels. convert_to_factor Flag. Whether convert variables factor (using output_*_label args) leave . keep_tmp_var Whether keep temporary variables output_all_unchecked_value (mostly debugging). Defaults FALSE.

title: Recodes Multiple Sets of Factor Variables of Checkbox Items — recode_checkbox_sets
text: Data frame/tibble.

title: Recodes Multiple Sets of Factor Variables of Checkbox Items — recode_checkbox_sets
text: Furthermore, function recodes variables within set missing variables missing - assumption respondent omitted . cases, e.g. one checkbox checked, variables can assumed consciously "selected".

title: Recodes Multiple Sets of Factor Variables of Checkbox Items — recode_checkbox_sets
code: n <- 100 set.seed(1241) tmp <- data.frame(a_1 = factor(sample(c("Car", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE)),            a_2 = factor(sample(c("Train", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE)),            a_3 = factor(sample(c("Bus", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE)),            a_4 = factor(sample(c("Flight", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE)),            b_1 = factor(sample(c("Apple", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE)),            b_2 = factor(sample(c("Orange", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE)),            b_3 = factor(sample(c("Banana", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE)),            b_4 = factor(sample(c("Grapes", NA), size = n, replace = TRUE))) tmp2 <- recode_checkbox_sets(tmp, var_patterns = c("^a_", "^b_[[:digit:]]$")) cbind(tmp, tmp2) #>      a_1   a_2  a_3    a_4   b_1    b_2    b_3    b_4          a_1          a_2 #> 1   <NA> Train  Bus Flight Apple   <NA> Banana Grapes Not selected     Selected #> 2   <NA> Train  Bus Flight Apple Orange Banana   <NA> Not selected what: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
text: Create _headers file 'Netlify' publishing set .htaccess .htpasswd files (FTP) placed specific subfolders.

title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
code: setup_access_restrictions(   remote_basepath = "/home/",   local_basepath,   rel_path_base_to_parent_of_user_restricted_folder = file.path("Reports", "2022",     "Mesos"),   warn = TRUE,   local_main_password_path = ".main_htpasswd_public",   username_folder_matching_df = NULL,   universal_usernames = c("admin"),   log_rounds = 12,   append_users = TRUE,   password_input = "prompt",   type = c("netlify", "apache") )

title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
text: remote_basepath String. Folder site located using FTP-server. Needed .htaccess-files. local_basepath String. Local folder website, typically "_site". rel_path_base_to_parent_of_user_restricted_folder String, relative path basepath folder restricted folders located. (E.g. "mesos"-folder) warn Flag. Whether provide warning error paths exist. local_main_password_path String. Path main file containing usernames passwords formatted colon username password. username_folder_matching_df Data frame. NULL (default), use folder names usernames. Otherwise, data frame two columns: "folder" "username" "folder" name folder "username" username folder. universal_usernames Character vector. Usernames local_main_htpasswd_path always access folder log_rounds Integer, number rounds bcrypt algorithm. higher time consuming harder brute-force. append_users Boolean, TRUE (default) create new users add local_main_password_path. See also password_input. password_input String, either "prompt" asks user input. Alternatively, number stored string generated random password said length: "8", "10", "12", "16" type Character vector. "netlify" create _headers file used Netlify. "apache" create .htaccess .htpasswd files used general FTP-servers.

title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
text: String, path newly created _headers-file .htaccess files.
